page.title: 14 Social Concerns
page.content: On the questionnaire sent out to the Buckley sample, the parents were given an opportunity to state what, in their opinion, should be done to improve the town. The replies were indicative of concern about a variety of improvements which they felt would prove most beneficial to the community. 38 wanted better recreation facilities for the young. 32 felt that improved shopping facilities, especially large department stores, would be highly desirable. 25 would like to see the provision of parks and gardens, and many felt that the large areas of common land would lend themselves admirably for this purpose. 23 were anxious to have the town 'cleaned up', and there are a number of 'eyesores'. 13 wanted better town planning and 12 improved roads. 10 wanted better policing.
